text:
I have ant (1.9.4) macros which accept path-like structure as src param and when i try run it I get 'FILE_NAME.java is not a directory'.

Build file text:
<project name="test" default="main">
    <macrodef name="testm">
        <element name="srcdir"/>
        <sequential>
            <javac destdir="target">
                <src>
                    <srcdir/>
                </src>
            </javac>
        </sequential>
    </macrodef>

    <target name="build-project">
        <testm>
            <srcdir>
                <fileset dir="src">
                    <include name="**/*.java"/>
                </fileset>
            </srcdir>
        </testm>
    </target>

    <target name="main" depends="build-project"/>
</project>
creator: nikon.webmaster@gmail.com

text:
This is not how srcdir works.

You are specifying the source files for javac while the <src> elements expects to get the *directories* that are the roots of the package hierarchies.  You want to say 

<testm>
  <srcdir>
    <pathelement location="src"/>
  </srcdir>
</testm>
